meanings.definition: A mark or indentation made by pressure
meanings.sent1: The imprint of the coin was left on the soft clay.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the imprint of her shoe on the sandy beach.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful paws left an imprint on the muddy floor.
meanings.sent4: The imprint of history can be seen in the ancient ruins.
meanings.sent5: The imprint of the seal on the document made it official.

meanings.definition: To establish firmly in the mind or memory
meanings.sent1: The teacher tried to imprint the lesson in the students' minds.
meanings.sent2: Her grandmother's wise words were imprinted in her memory.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly tried to imprint the silly dance moves in his friend's mind.
meanings.sent4: The beautiful scenery imprinted itself in her mind forever.
meanings.sent5: The traumatic experience imprinted a fear that lingered.

meanings.definition: To produce a mark or pattern on a surface
meanings.sent1: The artist used a stamp to imprint the design on the paper.
meanings.sent2: The heavy object accidentally imprinted a dent on the wooden table.
meanings.sent3: The child tried to imprint their handprint on the wet cement.
meanings.sent4: The logo was imprinted on the product packaging.
meanings.sent5: The tire tracks imprinted a trail in the soft mud.

meanings.sent1: The mentor's guidance had a positive imprint on her career.
meanings.sent2: The singer's performance left a lasting imprint on the audience.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes had a humorous imprint on the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The leader's vision left an inspiring imprint on the organization.
meanings.sent5: The author's words had a profound imprint on the reader's thoughts.
